Internal: Building QT application

11 months ago

The instructions below guide you through the process of building the QT application which launches the standalone version of SATurn and provides the interface through which the web-portal is shown to the user.

Windows

  1. Install Microsoft Visual Studio 2017 (Community editor is fine)

    SaturnDeveloper.exe/developer_tools/VisualStudioBootStrap.exe

  2. Install QT for MSVC 2017 and be sure to include QT WebEngine and QT Creator

    SaturnDeveloper.exe/developer_tools/qt-unified-windows-x86-3.0.2-online.exe

  3. Open QT Creator

    File->Open Project
    Navigate to saturn/src_qt/Launcher/Saturn.pro

  4. Switch to the "Release" build & click on the green play button to compile

  5. Create deployable version

    deploy_qt.bat
    (copies deployable version to build/qt along with all required QT libraries)

OSX

  1. Install the latest version of XCode
  2. Install QT 5.10.1 (be sure to select the QtWebEngine during install)

    If you install a different version of QT some of the links in saturn/src_qt_Launcher_fix_osx_executables.sh will need updated

Build QML File Helper

  1. Open QT Creator
  2. Load File Helper project

    File->Open Project
    Navigate to saturn/src_qt/FileReader/filereader.pro

  3. Click on configure for QT 5.10.1 Desktop
  4. Build->Build Project (be sure to be in release and not debug mode)

Build SATurn Launcher

  1. File->Open Project
    Navigate to saturn/src_qt/Launcher/Saturn.pro

  2. When prompted configure for QT 5.10.0
  3. Build->Build Project (be sure to be in release and not debug mode
  4. Run the following post-fix script

    saturn/src_qt/Launcher/fix_osx_executables.sh

  5. To test the build run the following

    cd saturn/build/qt

    Saturn.app/Contents/MacOS/Saturn DEFAULT http://localhost:8091 ALL –disable-web-security
